1009.name: The Shusher
1009.desc_negative: If DMG is dealt to an enemy <color=#CD6269>elite</color> or <color=#CD6269>boss</color>, said enemy also enters the <color=#D0A3E2>Control RES state</color>.
1009.desc_effect:
Deals 500,000 <color=#CD6269>Wind</color> DMG to the team leader's target. Enters Modified Mode if the target is an elite or boss while forcing it to <color=#D0A3E2>enter Modified Mode</color> as well.

CD: 15s. May be used up to 10 times.
1009.desc_background:
Condenses a large amount of Divine Grace into a beam that is then fired at the target, disabling its combat capabilities.

Though its approach is simple—even crude—it is highly portable, easy to use, and no less effective at dealing with elite enemies than any advanced weapon. This is just one of the many simple ingenuities that have come out of Xu Heng. After all, for the people of Xu Heng, the simplest method is often the most effective.

1004.name: Dark Erosion Force Field
1004.desc_negative:
All enemies inside the force field recover 5% HP when they are hit in a <color=#CD6269>Light</color>, <color=#CD6269>Water</color>, or <color=#CD6269>Fire</color> attack.

All friendly <color=#CD6269>Divine Grace</color> Mods inside the force field lose 20 Divine Grace every second. This effect is not affected by bonuses.
1004.desc_effect:
Drops a large force field on the team leader's target. Force field lasts 15s.

Lowers the <color=#D0A3E2>SPD</color> of all enemy Visbanes inside the force field by 80%. These enemies will also take 400,000 <color=#CD6269>Shadow</color> DMG every 1.5s. Every hit taken from the force field reduces <color=#CD6269>Physical</color> RES by 1%. Effect stacks without limit until the end of the stage.

CD: 75s. May be used up to 2 times.
1004.desc_background:
Generates a reverse erosion field that deals damage to and weakens Visbanes within range over time, causing them to take additional damage in subsequent battles.

This tech is an accidental outcome of studies on erosion phenomena. However, as it continues to absorb Divine Grace during operation, it reverses some of the damage to the enemy into a recovery effect. This is an item on the Cryptics' planned improvements list.
1004.lock_des: Unlocks after the Tutorial is completed.

1011.name: Quick Freeze
1011.desc_negative: Frozen enemies take 600% less <color=#CD6269>Thunder</color>, <color=#CD6269>Light</color>, <color=#CD6269>Shadow</color>, and <color=#CD6269>Ice</color> DMG. Effect does not stack, but lasts until the end of battle.
1011.desc_effect:
Immediately <color=#D0A3E2>freezes</color> enemies within a 10-meter radius of the team leader's target for 30s. Frozen enemies take 2,000% more <color=#CD6269>Physical</color>, <color=#CD6269>Wind</color>, and <color=#CD6269>Water</color> DMG.

CD: 60s. May be used up to 4 times.
1011.desc_background:
Hurls a can of liquid nitrogen at the target location that quickly freezes surrounding normal enemies, making them fragile and brittle.

Enemies are frozen quickly and the effect lasts for quite some time. Most importantly, the price of this device is extremely pocket-friendly. CORG's Jokurr branch maintains that the liquid nitrogen supply is the best deal they have ever signed with a local factory.
1011.lock_des: Unlocks after the Tutorial is completed.

1002.name: Field of Currents
1002.desc_negative:
The blast will hit friendly units. Hits landed on friendly units deal 12,000 <color=#CD6269>Thunder</color> DMG and reduce their <color=#D0A3E2>SPD</color> by 95% for 10s. Effect does not refresh. Friendly units that are hit once become immune to subsequent lightning strikes in the current round.

Lowers the <color=#CD6269>Physical</color>, <color=#CD6269>Water</color>, and <color=#CD6269>Ice </color> ATK of all friendly units by 80% for 30s each time it is triggered. Effect does not refresh.
1002.desc_effect:
Launches lightning strikes at random points within a 20-meter radius of the team leader's target every 0.8s for a total of 10 strikes. Each hit from these lightning strikes deals 300,000–500,000 <color=#CD6269>Thunder</color> DMG, and additionally <color=#D0A3E2>clears all of the target's RES</color> and <color=#D0A3E2>shackles</color> them for 5s. Effect durations refresh when re-triggered.

Skill use increases the <color=#CD6269>Wind</color> ATK of all friendly units by 60% for 20s. This effect does not refresh.

CD: 70s. May be used up to 3 times.
1002.desc_background:
Generates a ring-shaped electrical field which releases lightning strikes on the target area at a rapid clip, injuring friend and foe alike. Also causes paralysis and burn injuries.

The original idea behind this piece of equipment is to provide a more stable form of battlefield support than Thor can offer alone through the use of a remote device to guide the power of Mjölnir. However, the rampant, runaway lightning it generates seems to be more in line with Thor's grossly unrestrained style. The reason for this is unknown.

1003.name: Gravity Well
1003.desc_negative: 8s after skill use, reduces the <color=#D0A3E2>SPD</color> of all friendly units by 70% for 12s. Effect does not refresh.
1003.desc_effect:
<color=#D0A3E2>Gathers</color> all enemy units without Super Armor from a wider area to the team leader's target. The <color=#D0A3E2>Gather</color> effect lasts 15s.

10s after skill use, <color=#D0A3E2>shackles</color> all enemy units within a 5-meter range for 10s. Effect does not refresh.

CD: 50s. May be used up to 2 times.
1003.desc_background:
Places a warp anchor point, creating a gravity well that pulls nearby enemies toward its center. As the warp effect expands outwards, the disturbance in the gravity field will greatly affect mobility.

A tactical application of Cloudsong Ore gravity control tech that was once mistakenly believed to be an improvement to the vacuum AGI Mecha and which was sealed away for a long time.

1005.name: Heart Oscillation
1005.desc_negative: At detonation, all friendly Mods take <color=#CD6269>Light</color> DMG equal to 90% Max HP. This DMG is non-fatal.
1005.desc_effect:
Calibrates DreamLink to point at the team leader's target and gather energy to detonate after 5s.

At detonation, all non-elite human enemies within a 10-meter range are <color=#D0A3E2>converted into friendly units</color> until the end of the stage. All non-human enemies take 1,200,000 <color=#CD6269>Light</color> DMG.

Grants converted targets 8,000 Base ATK permanently.

CD: 70s. May be used up to 3 times.
1005.desc_background:
Releases powerful mind-interference waves, causing affected humans to fall into a dreamlike state of altered cognition and converting them into allies as a result.

A special application derived from DreamLink's overload phenomenon. Strictly for professional use only, as its usage is invariably accompanied by a highly destructive form of psychological shock.

1010.name: Assistance Agreement
1010.desc_effect:
Summons 6 agents from CORG's Quake Damage Control Department to the battlefield to assist in battle.

May be used only once during the stage.
1010.desc_background:
Sends a signal to CORG for reinforcements. A team of agents is then dispatched to the battlefield to provide support.

Your allies can arrive on the battlefield just when you need them most and eliminate threats with the utmost efficiency. However, you may have to follow their SOPs, even if it means some chaos in the thick of action.

1001.name: Remote Firepower Array
1001.desc_effect:
Zone is centered on the locked-on target.

Fires a long-range cannon barrage into a 3-meter area circling the team leader's target every 0.2s for a total of 20 shots. Each shot can deal 200,000–250,000 <color=#CD6269>Physical</color> DMG to the enemy.

CD: 70s. May be used up to 3 times.
1001.desc_background:
Calls in a bombardment attack by a railgun array on the target area, causing devastating damage to enemies within range.

Over-the-horizon firepower support provided by CORG with a high rate of fire and jaw-dropping lethality. However, this sort of abrupt firepower projection will inevitably cause some chaos on the field initially.

1012.name: Explosive Fuel Barrel
1012.desc_effect:
Causes an explosion where the team leader's target is, dealing 500,000 <color=#CD6269>Fire</color> DMG. If the target is a <color=#CD6269>Tower Visbane</color>, <color=#CD6269>elite</color>, <color=#CD6269>boss</color>, or unit with <color=#CD6269>Super Armor</color>, it will take 3,000,000 <color=#CD6269>Fire</color> DMG.

Enemies hit also take 40% more <color=#CD6269>Fire</color> DMG until the end of battle. Effect does not stack.

CD: 45s. May be used up to 5 times.
1012.desc_background:
Hurls a barrel of mixed fuels at the target location, generating an explosion that causes affected enemies to be unable to withstand the resulting flames.

This item was added to the list of strategic materials after a previous explosion on the frontline. While it is said that some CORG commanders are extremely enamored with the explosive power of this item, its high cost has always made the Logistics Department tear at their hair a little.

1008.name: Energy Interference
1008.desc_negative: Use of the weapon increases the ATK of all <color=#CD6269>non-Visbane</color> enemies by 350%. Effect does not stack, but lasts until the end of the stage.
1008.desc_effect:
Immediately <color=#D0A3E2>shackles</color> all enemy Visbanes on the battlefield for 15s. Effect does not refresh.

Use of the weapon grants 40 <color=#CD6269>Divine Grace</color> to all <color=#CD6269>Divine Grace</color> Mods on the battlefield. This effect is not affected by bonuses.

Use of the weapon <color=#D0A3E2>stops all enemy units from spawning</color> for 30s. (Does not include summoned units.) Enter <color=#D0A3E2>Zero Time</color> to <color=#D0A3E2>end the effect before it expires</color>.

CD: 60s. May be used up to 2 times.
1008.desc_background:
Interferes with and redirects the flow of Divine Grace on the battlefield, shackling Visbanes and supplying Divine Grace to friendly units.

This weapon, based on the same working principle as Circles of Reason, also comes with a chain effect which enhances the attack capabilities of non-Visbane enemies. As such, Heimdall has created a comprehensive user guide for this weapon. However, the guide is so detailed and complicated that no one has actually read it.
1008.lock_des: Unlocks after the Tutorial is completed.

1007.name: Pulsating Waves
1007.desc_negative:
Use of the weapon grants all enemy <color=#CD6269>Visbanes</color> an 80% reduction in Final DMG. Effect does not stack, but lasts until the end of the stage.

Use of the weapon depletes 40 Divine Grace from all <color=#CD6269>Divine Grace</color> Mods on the field. This effect is not affected by bonuses.

Hits landed on <color=#D0A3E2>stunned</color> enemies with <color=#CD6269>Physical</color>, <color=#CD6269>Water</color>, <color=#CD6269>Ice</color>, or <color=#CD6269>Wind</color> attacks remove the Stun effect and increase their DMG dealt by 500%. Effect does not stack and lasts until the end of the stage.
1007.desc_effect:
Immediately <color=#D0A3E2>stuns</color> all human enemies on the field for 20s. Effect does not refresh.

Use of the weapon <color=#D0A3E2>stops all enemy units from spawning</color> for 30s. (Does not include summoned units.) Enter <color=#D0A3E2>Zero Time</color> to <color=#D0A3E2>end the effect before it expires</color>.

CD: 60s. May be used up to 2 times.
1007.desc_background:
Unleashes precisely tuned sound and light shocks that cause human targets to suffer muscle paralysis and disorientation and thus lose their ability to move.

Although this piece of non-lethal equipment can be quite effective in terms of taming a chaotic battlefield, targets that unexpectedly regain consciousness will become extremely aggressive. Other complications of this equipment, such as Visbane enhancement and Divine Grace depletion, should not be overlooked either. Taking this into account, CORG sometimes intervenes preemptively to minimize the need for this device.

1006.name: Transistor Overload
1006.desc_negative:
Use of the weapon grants all enemy <color=#CD6269>Visbanes</color> an 80% reduction in Final DMG. Effect does not stack, but lasts until the end of the stage.

Use of the weapon depletes 40 Divine Grace from all <color=#CD6269>Divine Grace</color> Mods on the field. This effect is not affected by bonuses.

Hits landed on <color=#D0A3E2>shackled</color> enemies with either a <color=#CD6269>Thunder</color> or <color=#CD6269>Fire</color> attack remove the Shackle effect and simultaneously cause a small-scale explosion. Hits on a friendly unit from the explosion deal 15,000 <color=#CD6269>Physical</color> DMG.
1006.desc_effect:
Immediately <color=#D0A3E2>shackles</color> all AGI Mechas on the field for 30s. Effect does not refresh.

Use of the weapon <color=#D0A3E2>stops all enemy units from spawning</color> for 30s. (Does not include summoned units.) Enter <color=#D0A3E2>Zero Time</color> to <color=#D0A3E2>end the effect before it expires</color>.

CD: 60s. May be used up to 2 times.
1006.desc_background:
Releases resonance waves over a wide area, causing the transistors of all AGI Mechas on the battlefield to overload, temporarily immobilizing them.

This device can be an effective measure against enemy AGI Mechas. However, overloaded AGI Mechas will self-destruct if accidentally restarted, and operating the device will also strengthen Visbanes and deplete Divine Grace. For this reason, CORG has put strict rules in place for its usage.

2001.name: Shielding Force Field
2001.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
2001.desc_effect:
Turns all friendly Mods on the battlefield <color=#D0A3E2>Invincible</color> for 10s. Effect does not refresh.

CD: 40s. May be used up to 2 times.
2001.desc_background:
Creates a barrier force field using a portable generator to deflect all incoming attacks.

While rumor has it that it changes to another color when in use, no one has actually seen this happen yet. It may simply be the mistaken claim of an old soldier caught up in the smoke and disarray of the battlefield.

2004.name: Fire of Sacrifice
2004.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
2004.desc_effect:
Ignites a fire at the team leader's location. Fire will hit friendly units. Friendly units hit take <color=#CD6269>Fire</color> DMG equal to 50% Max HP, though they also deal 35% more <color=#CD6269>Fire</color> DMG for 30s. Effect does not refresh.

CD: 50s. May be used up to 2 times.
2004.desc_background:
Ignites a mysterious cursed fire and grants the ability to control fire in exchange for life.

Great power comes at an equally great price. What is certain is that its owner is walking on a rather shadowy path.
2004.lock_des: Unlocks after the Tutorial is completed.

2005.name: Regroup and Reboot
2005.desc_effect:
Enters <color=#D0A3E2>Zero Time</color> for 5s. Also refreshes the CD of the team leader's Dodge effect.

CD: 30s. May be used up to 4 times.
2005.desc_background:
Allows one to enter a Zero Time space created by Mimir to avoid surrounding threats and quickly recuperate inside.

Lord Mimir may have many secrets, but it's actually not too difficult to please him. Just give him a bottle of premium cola and he'll try his best to meet your needs.
2005.lock_des: Unlocks after the Tutorial is completed.

2002.name: Meridians of Healing
2002.desc_negative: Loses 5,000 HP every second for 5s if hit by the enemy within 5s of HP recovery.
2002.desc_effect:
Places a zone at the team leader's location which, 3s after use, <color=#D0A3E2>restores</color> 32,000 HP to all friendly units inside it.

CD: 45s. May be used up to 2 times.
2002.desc_background:
Through simulation of the characteristics of Lingguang's Divine Grace, places a patch of healing meridians on the target area for group healing.
Many in Xu Heng were injured during the Cloudsong Crisis, and this was the method that Zhu used to make Lingguang's work much, much easier back then. However, based on past records, meridian healing can cause the subject to be temporarily weakened, and so extra care is needed.

2003.name: Circulatory Boost
2003.desc_negative: Each time a friendly unit is affected, they lose 5% HP. Effect lasts until the end of the stage and can stack without limit.
2003.desc_effect:
Increases the <color=#CD6269>Thunder</color>, <color=#CD6269>Ice</color>, <color=#CD6269>Physical</color>, and <color=#CD6269>Light</color> DMG dealt by all friendly units within a 12.5-meter radius of the team leader by 30%, and <color=#D0A3E2>restores</color> 1,200 HP per second. Effect lasts 15s and does not refresh.

CD: 40s. May be used up to 3 times.
2003.desc_background:
Releases a stimulant drug in aerosol form to enhance the subject's combat potential and recovery efficiency. However, it will also cause stress to the body.

A secret weapon of Meruism's. Despite its unspeakable stink and odd side effects, it is still advisable to carry a bottle with you should you choose to walk on the fierce streets of Gar.

2006.name: Hotspot
2006.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
2006.desc_effect:
All enemies now target the team leader. Increases the team leader's DEF by 80% for 20s. Effect does not refresh.

CD: 35s. May be used up to 3 times.
2006.desc_background:
Transmits a wide-area multi-frequency signal to provoke the enemy and draw their attention to the team leader.

Countless traps and ambushes await the enemies drawn to the bait. Fairness is something that is not often found in the world of the bounty hunter.

2008.name: All an Illusion
2008.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
2008.desc_effect:
All friendly non-Mod units become <color=#D0A3E2>Invincible</color> for 12s. Effect does not refresh.

May be used only once during the stage.
2008.desc_background:
Creates an illusory space around friendly units that absorbs and dispels all incoming attacks.

In the shimmering mist, the moon's reflection can be seen on the petal-strewn surface of the water. Ethereal shadows embrace loved ones, and the endless storm is just a fleeting dream.

2007.name: Strings of Destiny
2007.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
2007.desc_effect:
Targets without Super Armor are immediately dragged to the team leader.

CD: 17s. May be used up to 12 times.
2007.desc_background:
Fires several puppet strings that bind the target and drag them to the Mod.

In the blink of an eye, the string of destiny is firmly tied around the object of the pursuit. This is not the prelude to a splendid dance, but merely an elegy to the return to peace.

3001.name: Dodge
3001.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
3001.desc_effect:
The team leader immediately tries to block or dodge.

CD: 5s.
3001.desc_background:
Instructs the team leader to immediately take up a defensive stance and evade or defend against incoming attacks.

CORG agents act in accordance with precise instructions in high-threat situations. Even their basic tactical actions are often directed in this manner.

3002.name: Focused Attack
3002.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
3002.desc_effect:
Commands all friendly units to attack the team leader's target.

CD: 2s.
3002.desc_background:
Instructs the squad to launch a joint operation and focused attack on the target.

Even the most powerful opponent might find the combined might of all the forces in this fierce attack to be too difficult to withstand. CORG's human agents often use this tactic to eliminate high-threat targets.

3003.name: Multi-Prong Assault
3003.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
3003.desc_effect:
Commands all friendly units to attack as many different targets as possible.

CD: 2s.
3003.desc_background:
Instructs the squad to carry out attacks on various targets separately.

This tactic makes full use of the combat capabilities of individual squad members, and CORG's Modifiers often use this tactic to deal with enemies with a numerical advantage.

4001.name: Close Order Formation
4001.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
4001.desc_effect:
Commands the entire squad to stop attacking and gather around the team leader. Ultimate Skill commands continue to apply for the duration.

Tap again to resume fire.
4001.desc_background:
Commands squad members to quickly gather around the team leader.

This formation facilitates cooperation and support within the team and improves their ability to deal with various unexpected developments. It is often used in recon operations where there is limited intel.

4002.name: Mobile Formation
4002.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
4002.desc_effect:
Commands the entire squad to stop attacking and distance themselves as much as possible from the team leader. Ultimate Skill commands continue to apply for the duration.

Tap again to resume fire.
4002.desc_background:
Commands squad team members to spread out into formation with the team leader at the center.

This formation trades immediate support between members for improved team survival when dealing with wide-area threats. It is often used to during cleanup and support tasks in disaster-stricken areas.

5001.name: Anti-Personnel Tactics I
5001.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5001.desc_effect: Friendly Mods deal 10% more DMG to humans after entering the battlefield.
5001.desc_background: A conventional countermeasure buff that is rarely used by elite Modifiers these days. Used in the right way, however, it can still be pretty useful.

5002.name: Anti-Personnel Tactics II
5002.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5002.desc_effect: Friendly Mods deal 20% more DMG to humans after entering the battlefield.
5002.desc_background: A conventional countermeasure buff that is rarely used by elite Modifiers these days. Used in the right way, however, it can still be pretty useful.

5003.name: Anti-Personnel Tactics III
5003.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5003.desc_effect: Friendly Mods deal 30% more DMG to humans after entering the battlefield.
5003.desc_background: A conventional countermeasure buff that is rarely used by elite Modifiers these days. Used in the right way, however, it can still be pretty useful.

5004.name: Anti-Mecha Tactics I
5004.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5004.desc_effect: Friendly Mods deal 10% more DMG to AGI Mechas after entering the battlefield.
5004.desc_background: A conventional countermeasure buff that is rarely used by elite Modifiers these days. Used in the right way, however, it can still be pretty useful.

5005.name: Anti-Mecha Tactics II
5005.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5005.desc_effect: Friendly Mods deal 20% more DMG to AGI Mechas after entering the battlefield.
5005.desc_background: A conventional countermeasure buff that is rarely used by elite Modifiers these days. Used in the right way, however, it can still be pretty useful.

5006.name: Anti-Mecha Tactics III
5006.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5006.desc_effect: Friendly Mods deal 30% more DMG to AGI Mechas after entering the battlefield.
5006.desc_background: A conventional countermeasure buff that is rarely used by elite Modifiers these days. Used in the right way, however, it can still be pretty useful.

5007.name: Anti-Visbane Tactics I
5007.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5007.desc_effect: Friendly Mods deal 10% more DMG to Visbanes after entering the battlefield.
5007.desc_background: A conventional countermeasure buff that is rarely used by elite Modifiers these days. Used in the right way, however, it can still be pretty useful.

5008.name: Anti-Visbane Tactics II
5008.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5008.desc_effect: Friendly Mods deal 20% more DMG to Visbanes after entering the battlefield.
5008.desc_background: A conventional countermeasure buff that is rarely used by elite Modifiers these days. Used in the right way, however, it can still be pretty useful.

5009.name: Anti-Visbane Tactics III
5009.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5009.desc_effect: Friendly Mods deal 30% more DMG to Visbanes after entering the battlefield.
5009.desc_background: A conventional countermeasure buff that is rarely used by elite Modifiers these days. Used in the right way, however, it can still be pretty useful.

5035.name: Fierce Assault I
5035.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5035.desc_effect: Friendly Mods gain an 8% ATK boost when entering the battlefield.
5035.desc_background: An offensive buff favored by elite Modifiers. Its call rights have been obtained following some negotiation, and it's expected that its use would provide general enhancements and improve overall combat efficiency.

5036.name: Fierce Assault II
5036.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5036.desc_effect: Friendly Mods gain a 16% ATK boost when entering the battlefield.
5036.desc_background: An offensive buff favored by elite Modifiers. Its call rights have been obtained following some negotiation, and it's expected that its use would provide general enhancements and improve overall combat efficiency.

5037.name: Fierce Assault III
5037.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5037.desc_effect: Friendly Mods gain an 24% ATK boost when entering the battlefield.
5037.desc_background: An offensive buff favored by elite Modifiers. Its call rights have been obtained following some negotiation, and it's expected that its use would provide general enhancements and improve overall combat efficiency.

5038.name: Enraged I
5038.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5038.desc_effect: Friendly Mods gain a 10% Crit DMG boost when entering the battlefield.
5038.desc_background: An offensive buff favored by elite Modifiers. Its call rights have been obtained following some negotiation, and it's expected that its use would enhance key attacks and end battles more quickly.

5039.name: Enraged II
5039.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5039.desc_effect: Friendly Mods gain a 20% Crit DMG boost when entering the battlefield.
5039.desc_background: An offensive buff favored by elite Modifiers. Its call rights have been obtained following some negotiation, and it's expected that its use would enhance key attacks and end battles more quickly.

5040.name: Enraged II
5040.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5040.desc_effect: Friendly Mods gain a 30% Crit DMG boost when entering the battlefield.
5040.desc_background: An offensive buff favored by elite Modifiers. Its call rights have been obtained following some negotiation, and it's expected that its use would enhance key attacks and end battles more quickly.

5010.name: Fortitude I
5010.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5010.desc_effect: Friendly Mods take 10% less DMG after entering the battlefield.
5010.desc_background: A conventional protection buff that is rarely used by elite Modifiers these days. However, it can still effectively ensure one's survival in certain situations.

5011.name: Fortitude II
5011.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5011.desc_effect: Friendly Mods take 20% less DMG after entering the battlefield.
5011.desc_background: A conventional protection buff that is rarely used by elite Modifiers these days. However, it can still effectively ensure one's survival in certain situations.

5012.name: Fortitude II
5012.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5012.desc_effect: Friendly Mods take 30% less DMG after entering the battlefield.
5012.desc_background: A conventional protection buff that is rarely used by elite Modifiers these days. However, it can still effectively ensure one's survival in certain situations.

5013.name: Offensive Fortification I
5013.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5013.desc_effect: Increases the Base ATK of all friendly non-Mod units on the battlefield by 400.
5013.desc_background:
Portable engineering equipment with offensive capabilities that can be rapidly deployed during combat for local support.

Comes in three grades to meet the needs of various combat missions.

5014.name: Offensive Fortification II
5014.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5014.desc_effect: Increases the Base ATK of all friendly non-Mod units on the battlefield by 800.
5014.desc_background:
Portable engineering equipment with offensive capabilities that can be rapidly deployed during combat for local support.

Comes in three grades to meet the needs of various combat missions.

5015.name: Offensive Fortification III
5015.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5015.desc_effect: Increases the Base ATK of all friendly non-Mod units on the battlefield by 1200.
5015.desc_background:
Portable engineering equipment with offensive capabilities that can be rapidly deployed during combat for local support.

Comes in three grades to meet the needs of various combat missions.

5016.name: Defensive Fortification I
5016.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5016.desc_effect: Increases the Base DEF of all friendly non-Mod units on the field by 1,000.
5016.desc_background:
Portable engineering equipment with defensive capabilities that can be rapidly deployed during combat for local support.

Comes in three grades to meet the needs of various combat missions.

5017.name: Defensive Fortification II
5017.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5017.desc_effect: Increases the Base DEF of all friendly non-Mod units on the field by 2,000.
5017.desc_background:
Portable engineering equipment with defensive capabilities that can be rapidly deployed during combat for local support.

Comes in three grades to meet the needs of various combat missions.

5018.name: Defensive Fortification III
5018.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5018.desc_effect: Increases the Base DEF of all friendly non-Mod units on the field by 4,000.
5018.desc_background:
Portable engineering equipment with defensive capabilities that can be rapidly deployed during combat for local support.

Comes in three grades to meet the needs of various combat missions.

5023.name: Restorative Potion
5023.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5023.desc_effect:
Takes effect 60s after the start of battle.

Restores 120 HP to all friendly Mods every second until the end of battle.
5023.desc_background: A slow-release healing drug that restores HP over time after a short delay. Although it is of limited use in a quick confrontation, it can maintain the user's combat effectiveness for a long time in a protracted battle.

5024.name: Emergency Potion
5024.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5024.desc_effect:
Restores 12,000 HP to friendly Mods when their HP has fallen below 10%. However, they will lose 12,000 HP over the next 100s.

May be used only once during the stage. Recovery effect does not preclude the effects of fatal DMG.
5024.desc_background: A "smart" medicine that is automatically released in the event of an emergency to quickly restore HP to a seriously injured user. Not suitable for routine treatment as the drug will also subsequently cause the user to slowly lose HP over time.

5041.name: Divine Grace Channeler
5041.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5041.desc_effect: Reduces the Mod Index Multiplier by 80% when friendly Mods enter the battlefield, though they deal 40% more DMG to normal enemies.
5041.desc_background: The result of one of the Cryptics' research projects. Significantly enhances attack power by partially directing the flow of Divine Grace. It is said that the project had stagnated for a long time, but was later quickly completed after researchers became inspired by some of Odin's powers.

5025.name: Unfetter I
5025.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5025.desc_effect: Friendly Mods gain a 15% Ultimate Skill charge when entering the battlefield.
5025.desc_background: A support weapon used by the Akkadian Guild's elite Modifiers that provides the user with a certain first-mover advantage. Multiple trades of this weapon have made its price far higher than that when acquired through regular channels. However, the guild's mercenaries have long since recovered the cost.

5026.name: Unfetter II
5026.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5026.desc_effect: Friendly Mods gain a 30% Ultimate Skill charge when entering the battlefield.
5026.desc_background: A support weapon used by the Akkadian Guild's elite Modifiers that provides the user with a certain first-mover advantage. Multiple trades of this weapon have made its price far higher than that when acquired through regular channels. However, the guild's mercenaries have long since recovered the cost.

5027.name: Unfetter III
5027.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5027.desc_effect: Friendly Mods gain a 45% Ultimate Skill charge when entering the battlefield.
5027.desc_background: A support weapon used by the Akkadian Guild's elite Modifiers that provides the user with a certain first-mover advantage. This is an advanced model from the early days, and does not appear to be a resource that a mercenary guild can get its hands on.

5028.name: Divine Grace Infusion I
5028.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5028.desc_effect: Increases the Mod Index Multiplier of all friendly non-Mod units on the field by 10%.
5028.desc_background: An important outcome of the R&D Center's Project Kandori. Attaches Divine Grace to common weapons, thus allowing human soldiers to fight elite Visbanes more effectively.

5029.name: Divine Grace Infusion II
5029.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5029.desc_effect: Increases the Mod Index Multiplier of all friendly non-Mod units on the field by 20%.
5029.desc_background: An important outcome of the R&D Center's Project Kandori. Attaches Divine Grace to common weapons, thus allowing human soldiers to fight elite Visbanes more effectively.

5030.name: Divine Grace Infusion III
5030.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5030.desc_effect: Increases the Mod Index Multiplier of all friendly non-Mod units on the field by 30%.
5030.desc_background:
An important outcome of the R&D Center's Project Kandori. Attaches Divine Grace to common weapons, thus allowing human soldiers to fight elite Visbanes more effectively.

We have believed in mankind's possibilities since the very beginning.

5031.name: Scouting the Enemy Line I
5031.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5031.desc_background: The Karasugos' Mihakashisyuu will scout the enemy line pre-battle, assist in the implementation of targeted defense plans, and weaken the enemy's offensive.

5032.name: Scouting the Enemy Line II
5032.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5032.desc_background: The Karasugos' Mihakashisyuu will scout the enemy line pre-battle, assist in the implementation of targeted defense plans, and weaken the enemy's offensive.

5033.name: Scouting the Enemy Line III
5033.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5033.desc_background:
The Karasugos' Mihakashisyuu will scout the enemy line pre-battle, assist in the implementation of targeted defense plans, and weaken the enemy's offensive.

It's been claimed that a CORG team was wiped out in an error caused by unreliable intel. But this piece of "intel" itself is similarly unreliable.

5034.name: Emergency Repair
5034.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5034.desc_effect:
Restores 40% HP when the HP of the communications line tower falls below 25%.

May be used only once during the stage. Does not preclude the effects of fatal DMG.
5034.desc_background:
Maintenance technology from Shuofang Isle in Xu Heng which can be used to quickly repair damage to mechanical structures and thus is used in emergency repairs of core fortifications.

This was originally a niche technology used for the maintenance of mining AGI Mechas. However, the judicious use of this tech can help win the battle.

5019.name: Level C Deployment
5019.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5019.desc_effect: -20 Disturbance Factors at the end of battle.
5019.desc_background: Post-battle, Aether Gazer will send its C-Grade Modifier team to help clean up the battlefield and restore order in the area. It might not be the most exciting of missions, but it's still their duty.

5020.name: Akkadian Guild Services Agreement
5020.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5020.desc_effect: -25 Disturbance Factors at the end of battle if no Visbanes have appeared during battle.
5020.desc_background: In the absence of Visbane activity, the Akkadian Guild's mercenary squad will assist in cleanup post-battle. Mercenaries may fight for money, but they do not make meaningless sacrifices.

5021.name: Knights of Convallaria Summons
5021.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5021.desc_effect: -25 Disturbance Factors at the end of battle if no Visbanes have appeared during battle.
5021.desc_background: Where there has been no Visbane activity, the Knights of Convallaria will assist in cleanup post-battle. Due to their own defensive needs and manpower limitations, the Knights of Convallaria are usually unable to send their elite forces out to fight.

5022.name: Tian Lu Security Services Contract
5022.desc_negative: Does not have any negative effects or cause any debuffs.
5022.desc_effect: -20 Disturbance Factors at the end of battle.
5022.desc_background: Post-battle, Tian Lu Traders will send its security team to help clean up the battlefield and restore order in the area. While there is little public information about this security force, what is known is enough to prove that it has sufficient strength and efficiency for the task.

6001.name: Modifier Command
6001.desc_negative:
+2,500 Disturbance Factors when the Mod team leader enters battle.

All active skills are forbidden from use.
6001.desc_effect: Allows the direct command of Modifiers in combat.
6001.desc_background:
The Director of the General Office has confirmed that this combat method is effective in certain high-risk operations. However, as the final line of defense for mankind, we do not factor any possible interventions by the Director into our combat decisions.

Therefore, our commanders have to master this method to ensure that they can successfully complete the mission even in the most unfavorable circumstances.
